meanings.definition: A secondary or auxiliary activity or occupation
meanings.sent1: During the weekend, gardening became her sideline.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys painting as a sideline to his main job.
meanings.sent3: His love for baking turned into a delicious sideline.
meanings.sent4: Photography started as a sideline but soon became his passion.
meanings.sent5: Her sideline of knitting keeps her relaxed and creative.

meanings.definition: A boundary line at the side of a playing field
meanings.sent1: The players stayed within the sideline during the game.
meanings.sent2: The ball rolled out of bounds past the sideline.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel ran along the sideline of the park.
meanings.sent4: The shadows of the trees stretched across the sideline.
meanings.sent5: The colorful flags marked the sideline of the soccer field.

meanings.definition: To remove from active duty or involvement
meanings.sent1: The injury sidelined him for the rest of the season.
meanings.sent2: She was sidelined from the project due to her conflicting schedule.
meanings.sent3: The bad weather sidelined the outdoor event.
meanings.sent4: His sudden illness sidelined his plans for the weekend.
meanings.sent5: The technical issue sidelined the entire team from the competition.
